source_sentence: 佛說頂生王因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo dingshengwang yinnian jing, vol. 3

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿傳
translation: Xitian Translation of the Tripiṭaka, Chaofeng Dafu, Xu Guanluqing's Biography

source_sentence: 法大師賜紫沙門臣施護等奉　詔譯
translation: The Great Master Dharma bestowed upon the purple monks, ministers Shi Hao and others, in accordance with the imperial edict, to translate this scripture.

source_sentence: 「復次，大王！
translation: "Again, my lord!

source_sentence: 其上即是三十三天所居之處，彼有龍王住於水際，所謂難陀龍王、烏波難陀龍王、阿說多哩龍王、母唧隣那龍王、摩那斯龍王、伊羅鉢怛羅龍王等，住壽經劫，護持世間，力無能敵。
translation: Up there is where the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven resides, and there are dragons standing at the water's edge, known as Dragon-King Nandana, Dragon-King Upananda, Dragon-King Asaudoori, Dragon-King Mokilinda, Dragon-King Manas, and Dragon-King Airāpattra, who live for eons and protect the world with unsurpassed strength.

source_sentence: 是諸龍王與堅首天、持鬘天、常驕天、四大王天，同為守護三十三天。
translation: These dragon kings, the Nāgârjuna Heaven, the Garland-Carrying Heaven, the Ever-Proud Heaven, and the Four Great Kings Heaven are all guardians of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 若阿修羅來鬪戰時，即各對敵及為震警。
translation: When asuras come to fight, they each confront their opponent and provide a warning.

source_sentence: 「爾時，頂生王將復前進，為諸龍王遮止導翼兵眾。
translation: "At the time, King Tiṅgāra was about to advance and stop the dragons and guide their troops.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why isn't he advancing?'

source_sentence: 時主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The lord of the hour, the god of war, replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此是龍王遮止兵眾。』
translation: This is the dragon king who keeps his army at bay.'

source_sentence: 王言：『而龍王者，傍生之類，非我所敵，今悉驅令為我導翼。』
translation: The king said, 'And that dragon king, a species of unenlightened animal, is no match for me, so now I'll have all of them guide me.'

source_sentence: 言已，諸龍即導王前至堅首天王所。
translation: After he said that, the dragons led the king forward to King Cantilevers.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝等何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The king of the gods asked, 'Why have you rushed here?'

source_sentence: 諸龍答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The dragons answered, 'There's a king among men named Tiṅgāra who's about to come here, so I'll guide him forward.'

source_sentence: 時堅首天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The king of the firmament then again stopped them and didn't allow them to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you go forward?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The chief military deity replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此有堅首天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: 'There's this firm-headed celestial king who keeps the troops at bay.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此堅首天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This firm-headed god also makes himself available to me as a guide.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至持鬘天王所。
translation: After he said that, that god led the king forward to King Māra-bearing Heaven.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The god king asked, 'Why have you rushed here?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The king of gods answered, 'There's a king among men named Tiṅgāra who's about to come here, so I'll guide him forward.'

source_sentence: 時持鬘天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The garland-bearing god king then again stopped him and didn't allow him to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why don't you go forward?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The chief military deity replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此有持鬘天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: 'There's this garland-bearing god king who keeps the troops at bay.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此持鬘天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This garland-bearing god also makes himself available to me as a guide.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至常驕天王所。
translation: After he said that, that god led the king forward to King Everlasting Pride.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The god king asked, 'Why have you rushed here?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The king of gods answered, 'There's a king among men named Tiṅgāyana who's about to come here, so I'll guide him forward.'

source_sentence: 時常驕天王即復遮止不令前進。
translation: The eternally proud king of gods then again stopped him and didn't allow him to advance.

source_sentence: 王乃問言：『何不進邪？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why doesn't he go forward?'

source_sentence: 主兵神答言：『天子！
translation: The chief military deity replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此有常驕天王遮止兵眾。』
translation: 'This is the king of the Ever-proud gods who keeps the troops at bay.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此常驕天亦使為我導翼之者。』
translation: The king said, 'This Ever Pride Celestial also makes himself available to me as a guide.'

source_sentence: 言已，彼天即導王前至四大天王所。
translation: After he said that, the gods led the king forward to the four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 彼天王問言：『汝今何故奔馳來此？』
translation: The god king asked, 'Why have you rushed here?'

source_sentence: 天王答言：『人間有王，名曰頂生，彼將至此，故我導前。』
translation: The god kings answered, 'There's a king among men named Tiṅgāyana who's about to come here, so I'll guide him.'

source_sentence: 「爾時四大天王互相議曰：『此人間王，具大福德，有大名稱，我等豈能與相違背。』
translation: "The four great celestial kings then conferred with each other, saying, 'This human king has great merit and a great reputation, how could we possibly contradict him?'

source_sentence: 言已，俱詣帝釋天主所，具陳上事。
translation: After they said that, they all went to Lord Indra and explained the above matters in detail.

source_sentence: 時帝釋天主言：『此大福德，有大名稱，我亦不應與相違背。』
translation: The Śakra Devānām-Indra then said, 'This great man of merit has a great reputation, and I shouldn't contradict it.'

source_sentence: 言已，即持妙閼伽瓶，前起承迎。
translation: After he said that, he took the Śubhavyūha vial and rose to greet it.

source_sentence: 「爾時，頂生王遙見須彌山上樹林蓊欝，其密如雲，聳直紺青，色狀殊麗；乃問導翼夜叉神禰舞迦言：『前有樹林斯名何等？』
translation: "At the time, King Tiṣya saw from afar a grove of trees on Mount Sumeru that was as dense as a cloud, standing straight up and of a deep blue color and appearance, and he asked the guiding winged night-shark god Īndraka, 'What's the name of this grove of trees up ahead?'

source_sentence: 禰舞迦答言：『天子！
translation: Nandika replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此是三十三天中，波利質多羅樹及俱毘陀羅樹等，彼諸天眾夏四月中，於其樹下五欲娛樂嬉戲自在。
translation: "Among the Trāyastriṃśa gods, these are the paricitra tree and the kubitra tree, among others, under which a multitude of gods spend the fourth month of summer playing with the five desires.

source_sentence: 天子！
translation: Sons of God!

source_sentence: 今時往彼亦受斯樂。』
translation: Now, I'll go there and enjoy it, too.'

source_sentence: 時王聞已，謂諸臣佐言：『汝等前見樹林如雲紺青不？』
translation: After hearing this, the king addressed his ministers, saying, 'Did you see the forest like a cloud of deep blue trees?'

source_sentence: 臣佐答言：『唯然已見。』
translation: The minister replied, 'Yes, I've seen it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此是三十三天中，波利質多羅樹及俱毘陀羅樹等，彼諸天眾夏四月中，於其樹下五欲娛樂嬉戲自在；汝等往彼亦受斯樂。』
translation: The king said, 'Among the Trāyastriṃśa gods, there are the paricitra tree and the kubitra tree, and so on, under which gods enjoy the pleasures of the five desires during the fourth month of summer; you should also go there to experience such pleasures.'

source_sentence: 「時頂生王又復前進，見須彌山上白雲高起聚若山峯，復問禰舞迦言：『前有白雲聚若高峯，斯名何等？』
translation: "Then, as he was advancing again, the king of the gods saw white clouds rising high on Mount Sumeru like mountain peaks, and he asked him, 'What's the name of that white cloud that's gathered high on a mountain peak?'

source_sentence: 禰舞迦答言：『天子！
translation: Nandika replied, 'My lord!

source_sentence: 此是三十三天中善法之堂，彼天子眾與四大天王常共集會，思惟觀察稱量世間，若天若人諸所有事。
translation: "This is the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, where a multitude of celestials and the four celestial kings always assemble together to contemplate and observe all the things in the world, whether they're gods or humans.

source_sentence: 天子！
translation: Sons of gods!

source_sentence: 今時宜應往彼。』
translation: It's time to go there.'

source_sentence: 其王聞已，謂諸臣佐言：『汝等前見白雲高起聚若山峯不？』
translation: After the king heard this, he said to his ministers, 'Did you see the white clouds rising up like mountain peaks?'

source_sentence: 臣佐答言：『唯然已見。』
translation: The minister replied, 'Yes, I've seen it.'

source_sentence: 王言：『此是三十三天中善法之堂，彼天子眾與四大天王常共集會，思惟觀察稱量世間，若天若人諸所有事；汝等今時宜應往彼。』
translation: The king said, 'This is the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven's hall of good qualities, where the sons of gods and the four celestial kings always assemble together to contemplate and observe all the works of the world, whether divine or human, and it would be well for you to go there now.'

source_sentence: 「復次，須彌山上三十三天中有善見城，其城縱廣正等二千五百由旬，周匝十千由旬，有七重城，彼一一城高一由旬半，純金所成。
translation: "Furthermore, on Mount Sumeru in the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven there's the City of Good Vision, which measures exactly 2,500 leagues in width and 10,000 leagues in circumference and has seven layers of cities, each of which is a league and a half high and made of pure gold.

source_sentence: 金城之上一一復有四種女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；復有重牆通往來道亦四寶成。
translation: On top of each of those gold cities are four other women's walls made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pattra, and there are also four other walls leading into the future path that are made of four treasures.

source_sentence: 彼城中地有百一種采繪嚴飾，又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: The floor of that city is decorated with a hundred different kinds of decorations, and it's soft like a tulip and flexible like a marvelous [tuft of] hair, which sinks as it falls and rises as it's lifted.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: There are celestial maṇḍala flowers scattered across the ground that are knee-deep, and the fragrant breezes blow away the withered flowers when they come and rain new ones.

source_sentence: 彼善見城有一千一門，其一一門長二由旬半，闊半由旬，皆以牛頭旃檀香木所成；彼一一門，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦寶間錯莊嚴，狀如星象及半月相。
translation: In that city of good views, there are 1,001 gates, each one two and a half leagues long and a half league wide, each made of wood scented with ox-head sandalwood; at each gate, gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pattra jewelry are interlaced and adorned like stars and the half-moon.

source_sentence: 又一一門各有五百青衣夜叉，身被甲冑而作守衛；又能護持三十三天諸天子眾作諸善利。
translation: At each gate, there are five hundred blue-clad yakṣas wearing armor and guarding them, and they're capable of guarding the Trāyastriṃśa gods and their descendants and doing good works.

source_sentence: 城中街衢長二百五十由旬，闊十二由旬，種種莊嚴金沙布地，觸處遍灑旃檀香水，金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸以界道側。
translation: The city's streets are 250 leagues long and 12 leagues wide, covered with ornate gold sand, perfumed with sandalwood everywhere they touch, and lined with gold cords and draped with gold bells to border the road.

source_sentence: 「街衢左右復有種種清淨池沼，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底，池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴；若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；清涼甘美水滿池中；優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內。
translation: "On the right and left of the street there are various pure ponds with gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pāṭika at their bottoms, and on the four sides of the pond there are four staircases made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pāṭika; in that pond there are four jeweled platforms, adorned interspersed with gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pāṭika; if gold is the platform, silver is the pillar and the beams, if silver is the platform, gold is the pillar and the beams, if lapis lazuli is the platform, pāṭika is the pillar and the beams, and if pāṭika is the platform, lapis lazuli is the pillar and the beams; the cool, sweet water fills the pond; the blue lotus, the white lotus, the kumuda flower, and the puṇḍarīka flower cover it.

source_sentence: 復有種種水鳥遊戲池中出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: There are also all kinds of waterfowl swimming in the pond that produce wonderful sounds, which are lofty sounds, pleasing sounds, and beautiful sounds.

source_sentence: 「復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線，妙巧安布盤結成鬘，華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: "Again, there are various kinds of flowering and fruiting trees that grow upright and stand straight up perfectly round without loss, like a garland maker who takes a wonderful thread and delicately spreads it into a disk to form a garland, and so it is with a grove of flowering and fruiting trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: That tree also has various flying birds that roam its perches and make wonderful sounds.

source_sentence: 又彼城中有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣；若彼天男及天女等思其衣者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: Also, in that city there's the blue, yellow, red, and white kaparāsa tree, and from that tree come four wonderful colors of clothing; if gods and goddesses contemplate those clothes, they'll reach them themselves when they first get their minds around them.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等；若彼天男及天女等思音樂者，纔起心時其樂自鳴。
translation: There are also trees of various kinds of marvelous music, such as the flute, flutes, lutes, and harps; if those godly men and goddesses contemplate music, their music will naturally sound when they first arise in thought.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具；若彼天男及天女等思莊嚴具者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: There are also various trees of marvelous adornment, which produce hand-ringlets, foot-rings, and the finery of adornment for the body; if those gods and goddesses contemplate the finery, they reach for it themselves when they first arise in thought.

source_sentence: 又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白；若彼天男及天女等思其食者，纔起心時而自至手。
translation: There are also four kinds of food that taste like soda, which are blue, yellow, red, and white; if those godly men and goddesses contemplate their food, they reach for it themselves when they first arise in thought.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: There are also four kinds of milk that they drink, which are madhurā, madanet, kāthamālī, and pāṇḍarī.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女眾或處其中安隱而坐，或觀視遊行，悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具，天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香豐諸飲食。
translation: There are also various wonderfully ornamented halls and mansions where the goddesses either sit quietly or watch the processions, are supplied with various carts and adornments, and the goddesses run about beating drums and singing, and burn multitudes of famous incense and rich foods.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: Those gods and their retinues play and entertain themselves, and they receive this excellent result based on their own merits.

source_sentence: 「復次，善見城東二十由旬，有園名寶車，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬，內外嚴麗殊妙可觀。
translation: "Furthermore, 20 leagues east of the city of Sunrise, there's a park called Jeweled Chariot, measuring exactly 250 leagues in width and a thousand leagues in circumference, with an interior and exterior that's beautiful and sublime to behold.

source_sentence: 園有金牆高半由旬；金牆之上有四女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；復有重牆通往來道亦四寶作。
translation: The garden has a gold wall half a league high, and above that gold wall are four women's walls made of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, and pāṭika; another, repeated wall leading down the road is also made of four treasures.

source_sentence: 其園中地有百一種采繪嚴飾；又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: The ground in the garden is decorated with a hundred different kinds of decorations, and it's as soft as a hovenia and as fine as a tuft of [hair], with its lower legs sinking in and its upper legs rising up.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地，深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: There are divine maṇḍala flowers scattered across the ground, knee-deep, and the fragrant breezes blow away the withered flowers and rain down new ones from time to time.

source_sentence: 寶車園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴；若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；清涼甘美水滿池中；優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內。
translation: 寶車園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴；若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；清涼甘美水滿池中；優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內。

source_sentence: 復有種種水鳥遊戲池中出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: There are also all kinds of waterfowl swimming in the pond that produce wonderful sounds, such as lofty sounds, pleasing sounds, and beautiful sounds.

source_sentence: 復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線妙，巧安布盤結成鬘，華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: There are also various kinds of flowering and fruiting trees that grow upright and stand upright, round, and without loss, like a garland maker who takes a wonderful thread and skillfully spreads it on a tray to form a garland, and so it is with a grove of flowering and fruiting trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: From that tree, there are also various flying birds that roam its perches and make wonderful sounds.

source_sentence: 觸處皆有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣。
translation: Everywhere they touch it, there are four kaparda trees of blue, yellow, red, and white, and from those trees come four wonderful colors of clothing.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等。
translation: There are also various trees of marvelous music, such as the flute, flutes, lutes, and harps.

source_sentence: 又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具。
translation: There are also trees of various kinds of marvelous adornment, from which come hand-ringed and foot-ringed garments and the body is adorned with marvelous implements.

source_sentence: 又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白。
translation: There's also food of the four flavors of sudhā, which are blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等隨所思者，纔起心時而皆自至。
translation: If those gods and goddesses follow their thoughts, they'll all arrive when they first arise in mind.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: There are also four kinds of milk that they drink, which are madhurdha milk, madanet milk, kāthamālī milk, and pāna milk.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女眾或處其中安隱而坐，或觀視遊行，悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具。
translation: There are also various wonderfully ornamented halls and mansions where the goddesses either sit quietly or watch the processions, and they're all supplied with various carts and adornments.

source_sentence: 天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香，豐諸飲食。
translation: The goddesses beat drums and play songs, burn famous incense, and eat and drink abundantly.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: Those gods and their retinues play and entertain themselves, and they receive this excellent result based on their own merits.

source_sentence: 「園中道路長二十由旬，闊半由旬，清淨嚴飾金沙布地；觸處遍灑旃檀香水；金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸；道路左右亦有種種華果樹林，飛鳥遊戲出妙音聲；亦有四色劫波衣樹及音樂樹莊嚴樹等；復有四種莊嚴輿輦，謂象乘、馬乘、車乘、寶輿；若彼天男及天女等思其乘馭往遊戲者，纔起心時隨思即至，乘已遊行受諸快樂。
translation: "In the park, the pathway is 20 leagues long and half a league wide, and it's covered with a pure, ornamented floor of gold sand; everywhere it touches, perfume of sandalwood is sprinkled; gold cords are twisted together and draped with gold bells; on the left and right of the pathways, there are groves of various flowers and fruits, and birds of prey play with the wonderful sounds; there are also four colorful kaparda trees, music trees, ornament trees, and so forth; and there are four other kinds of ornamented carts, which are elephant carts, horse carts, chariot carts, and jeweled mounts.

source_sentence: 「此園何故名為寶車？
translation: "Why is this park called a jeweled chariot?

source_sentence: 謂此園中所有池沼、華果、樹林、衣服、嚴具及天女等，皆以眾寶所莊嚴故；又有寶車諸天子眾乘馭遊戲，以是緣故名寶車園。
translation: This park contains ponds, marshes, flowers, fruits, groves, clothing, ornaments, and celestial women, all adorned with many treasures, and there are chariots made of jewels that are used by gods and sons to ride and play in, which is why it's called the Jeweled Chariot Park.

source_sentence: 「復次，寶車園東二十由旬，有寶嚴地，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬；有百一種采繪嚴飾清淨柔軟；其地中間有四寶臺間錯莊嚴；天曼陀羅華散布其地；道路長二十由旬，闊半由旬清淨嚴飾；華果、樹林、衣服、音樂、莊嚴等樹一一具足；亦有輿輦隨思即至受諸快樂。
translation: "Furthermore, 20 leagues east of the Chariot Park, there's a jeweled adornment ground that's exactly 250 leagues across and a thousand leagues around, with a hundred different kinds of decorations and finery that are pure and gentle, and in the middle of that ground there's a four-jeweled dais interspersed with adornments, with heavenly maṇḍala flowers scattered about, a path 20 leagues long and half a league wide that's decorated with pure adornments, and trees that are full of flowers and fruits, groves, clothing, music, adornments, and so forth, and a mule that can be used to bring pleasure when you think about it.

source_sentence: 彼有天仙修習梵行。
translation: There are celestials there who are cultivating the religious practice.

source_sentence: 「復次，善見城南二十由旬，有園名麤堅，縱廣正等二百五十由旬，周匝千由旬，內外嚴麗殊妙可觀；園有金牆高一由旬；金牆之上有四女牆，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；復有重牆通往來道亦四寶作。
translation: "Furthermore, 20 leagues south of the city of Sunrise, there's a park called Gwanghan, measuring exactly 250 leagues in width and a thousand leagues in circumference, which is beautiful and sublime inside and out.

source_sentence: 其園中地有百一種采繪嚴飾；又復柔軟如兜羅緜及如妙[疊*毛]，下足隨陷舉足隨起。
translation: The ground in the garden is decorated with a hundred different kinds of paint; it's soft like a hovenia and soft like a marvelous [tuft of] hair, and as it sinks in, its lower legs rise up.

source_sentence: 有天曼陀羅華散布其地深可膝量，香風時來吹去萎華更雨新者。
translation: There are celestial maṇḍala flowers scattered across the ground that are knee-deep and whose fragrant breezes blow away the withered flowers when they come and rain new ones.

source_sentence: 「麤堅園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴，若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；清涼甘美水滿池中；優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內；復有種種水鳥遊戲池中，出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。
translation: 「麤堅園中有大池沼，縱廣正等五十由旬，周匝二百由旬，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等以布其底；池之四面有四梯陛，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦成；彼池沼中有四寶臺，金、銀、瑠璃、頗胝迦等間錯莊嚴，若金為臺即銀為柱及以梁棟，若銀為臺即金為柱及以梁棟，若瑠璃為臺即頗胝迦為柱及以梁棟，若頗胝迦為臺即瑠璃為柱及以梁棟；清涼甘美水滿池中；優鉢羅華、鉢訥摩華、俱母陀華、奔拏利迦華等，遍覆其內；復有種種水鳥遊戲池中，出妙音聲，謂高遠聲、悅意聲、美妙聲等。

source_sentence: 「復有種種華樹果樹，直生端立圓無缺減，如結鬘師取以妙線，妙巧安布盤結成鬘，華果樹林亦復如是。
translation: "Again, there are various kinds of flowering and fruiting trees that grow upright and stand perfectly round without loss, like a garland maker who takes a wonderful thread and delicately spreads it into a disk to form a garland, and so it is with a grove of flowering and fruiting trees.

source_sentence: 彼樹復有種種飛鳥，遊止其上出妙音聲。
translation: From that tree, there are also various flying birds that roam its perches and make wonderful sounds.

source_sentence: 觸處皆有青、黃、赤、白四色劫波衣樹，其樹所出四色妙衣；又有種種妙音樂樹，所謂簫、笛、琴、箜篌等；又有種種妙莊嚴樹，彼樹所出手釧足環，及身莊嚴妙好之具；又有四色蘇陀味食，謂青、黃、赤、白。
translation: Everywhere they touch it, there's the blue, yellow, red, and white kaparda tree, which produces four kinds of marvelous clothing; the various trees of marvelous music, such as the flute, flutes, lutes, and harps; the various trees of marvelous adornment, which produce hand and foot rings and the finery of adornment for the body; and the four kinds of sugary food, which are blue, yellow, red, and white.

source_sentence: 若彼天男及天女等隨所思者，纔起心時而皆自至。
translation: If those gods and goddesses follow their thoughts, they'll all arrive when they first arise in mind.

source_sentence: 又有四種所飲之漿，謂末度漿、摩達網漿、迦譚末梨漿、播曩漿等。
translation: There are also four kinds of milk that they drink, which are madhurā, madanet, kāthamālī, and pāṇḍarī.

source_sentence: 復有種種殊妙莊嚴殿堂樓閣，諸天女等或處其中安隱而坐、或觀視遊行，悉有種種輿輦服用莊嚴之具，天女駢隘擊鼓奏歌，爇眾名香豐諸飲食。
translation: There are also various wonderfully ornamented halls and mansions where goddesses either sit quietly or watch the processions, various carts and carts carrying ornamental equipment, a procession of goddesses beating drums and singing, and fires of famous incense and plenty of food.

source_sentence: 而彼天眾與諸眷屬嬉戲娛樂，隨自福力受斯勝果。
translation: Those gods and their retinues play and entertain themselves, and they receive this excellent result based on their own merits.

source_sentence: 「園中道路長二十由旬，闊半由旬，清淨嚴飾金沙布地；觸處遍灑旃檀香水，金繩交絡垂金鈴鐸。
translation: "The path in the garden is twenty leagues long and half a league wide, and it's covered with a pure, ornamented floor of gold sand, with sandalwood perfume sprinkled everywhere it touches and gold bells draped with gold cords.

source_sentence: 道路左右亦有種種華果樹林，飛鳥遊戲出妙音聲；亦有四色劫波衣樹及音樂樹莊嚴樹等；復有四種莊嚴輿輦，謂象乘、馬乘、車乘、寶輿；若彼天男及天女等思其乘馭往遊戲者，纔起心時隨思即至，乘已遊行受諸快樂。
translation: On the left and right of the road there are groves of various flowers and fruits, where birds of prey play and make wonderful sounds; there are also four colorful kaparda trees, music trees, ornamented trees, and so forth; and there are four other kinds of ornamented mounts, including elephant mounts, horse mounts, chariot mounts, and jeweled mounts.

source_sentence: 「此園何故名為麤堅？
translation: "Why is this park called Gobihara?

source_sentence: 謂此園中所有池沼、華果、樹林、衣服、嚴具及天女等悉麤堅故；又此園中諸天子眾，若身若心皆悉麤猛而好鬪戰，由是緣故名麤堅園。
translation: It means that all the ponds, flowers, fruits, trees, clothing, ornaments, and goddesses in this park are coarse and hard; and the crowds of gods and sons in this park are all coarse and fierce in body and mind and are eager to fight, so that's why it's called the Coarse and Hard Park.

source_sentence: 佛說頂生王因緣經卷第三
translation: Foshuo dingshengwang yinnian jing, vol. 3
